sentences.en: a young salesman eager to clinch the deal
sentences.cn: 一名急于想做成这笔生意的年轻推销员

sentences.en: China has a saying: " not not clinch a deal. "
sentences.cn: 中国有一句古话: “ 不打不成交 ” .

sentences.en: Evidently this information clinched the matter.
sentences.cn: 显然这一信息解决了这个问题。

sentences.en: He seemed to favour using the clinch on his opponent.
sentences.cn: 看上去他喜欢对他的对手使用扭抱的战术.

sentences.en: How did you manage to clinch the deal?
sentences.cn: 你把那协议谈妥了,是怎么做到的?

sentences.en: It can work in conjunction with sales and promotional activities to clinch a deal.
sentences.cn: 它与销售与促销两项工作结合起来招揽生意.

sentences.en: Mike Bryan talked about getting the chance to clinch the victory.
sentences.cn: 迈克·布莱恩谈论有机会取得胜利.

sentences.en: Rossoneri went on to beat Boca Juniors 4 - 2 to clinch the trophy.
sentences.cn: 圣西罗的球队4:2击败了博卡青年,赢得了世界冠军.

sentences.en: The lovers were in a clinch.
The two lovers were locked in a clinch.
These are true old fashioned clinch nails that a blacksmith would use.
sentences.cn: 这些的确是铁匠会用到的老式钉子.

sentences.en: They were caught in a clinch when their parents returned home unexpectedly.
sentences.cn: 父母突然回家，撞见他俩拥抱在一起。

sentences.en: To clinch ( a bolt, for example ).
Wait, before I break up clinch a deal the record calculates.
sentences.cn: 等一下, 我翻一下之前的成交记录算算.

sentences.en: We realize that it is not easy to clinch the medals.
sentences.cn: 大家意识到想夺取奖牌已经不是那么容易了.

sentences.en: When the police came the fighters were in a clinch.
sentences.cn: 警察到来时,打架的人正扭成一团.

words.tran_cn: [机] 紧钳；敲弯钉头的工具

trans.tran_en: a situation in which two people who love each other hold each other tightly
The thing that clinches an uncertain matter settles it or provides a definite answer

trans.tran_cn: <非正>解决（争端、交易），达成（协议），敲弯
